currentFile.content:
import click
from flask.cli import with_appcontext
from werkzeug.security import generate_password_hash
from app import db
from models import Organization, Role, User

def seed_roles():
    roles = [
        {"name": "SUPER_ADMIN", "description": "Super administrator with all permissions."},
        {"name": "ADMIN", "description": "Administrator with organization-wide permissions."},
        {"name": "HR_MANAGER", "description": "HR manager with employee management permissions."},
        {"name": "EMPLOYEE", "description": "Regular employee with limited permissions."},
    ]
    for role_data in roles:
        role = Role.query.filter_by(name=role_data["name"]).first()
        if not role:
            role = Role(name=role_data["name"], description=role_data["description"])
            db.session.add(role)
            click.echo(f"✅ Created role: {role.name}")
        else:
            click.echo(f"✅ Role '{role.name}' already exists")
    db.session.commit()

def seed_organization():
    org_name = "AKS Logistics"
    org = Organization.query.filter_by(name=org_name).first()
    if not org:
        org = Organization(name=org_name)
        db.session.add(org)
        db.session.commit()
        click.echo(f"✅ Created organization: {org_name}")
    else:
        click.echo(f"✅ Organization '{org_name}' already exists")
    return org

def seed_super_admin(org):
    email = "superadmin@akslogistics.com"
    user = User.query.filter_by(email=email).first()
    if user:
        click.echo("✅ Super Admin user already exists")
        return
    role = Role.query.filter_by(name="SUPER_ADMIN").first()
    if not role:
        click.echo("❌ SUPER_ADMIN role not found. Please seed roles first.")
        return
    password_hash = generate_password_hash("Admin@123")
    user = User(
        username="superadmin",
        email=email,
        password_hash=password_hash,
        first_name="Super",
        last_name="Admin",
        organization_id=org.id,
        role_id=role.id,
        must_reset_password=False,
        is_active=True
    )
    db.session.add(user)
    db.session.commit()
    click.echo("✅ Super Admin user created")

@click.group()
def seed():
    """Seed the database with default roles, organization, and Super Admin user."""
    pass

@seed.command("run")
@with_appcontext
def run():
    try:
        seed_roles()
        org = seed_organization()
        seed_super_admin(org)
    except Exception as e:
        db.session.rollback()
        click.echo(f"❌ Error during seeding: {e}")
        raise
    finally:
        db.session.close()

# To register the CLI command, add the following to your app.py or main.py:
# from seed import seed
# app.cli.add_command(seed)

content.text: flask db history
flask db current
My Flask + PostgreSQL development database crashed during Alembic migration due to a laptop shutdown, and now I’m getting this error:
Can't read recordId(=845703, offset: 3382872]: outside of allocated region [<2073768]
I want to completely fix this cleanly. Please do the following:
Drop and recreate the development database from scratch.
Database name is the same as used in the .env / SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI.
It’s safe to drop because this is a dev environment.
Re-run Flask-Migrate migrations so that the database schema is fully recreated:
flask db upgrade
Re-run seed data to insert:
Default organization: AKS Logistics
Roles: SUPER_ADMIN, ADMIN, HR_MANAGER, EMPLOYEE
Super Admin user (with secure hashed password)
Confirm the database structure matches the latest models with:
flask db current
flask db history
Start the Flask application to ensure everything runs without corruption errors.
⚠️ If needed, generate a fresh migration from the models using flask db revision --autogenerate if the existing migrations are broken.
✅ Expected Outcome:
Database is cleanly recreated
All migrations apply successfully
Seed data is populated
Flask app runs without the “outside of allocated region” error

import click
from flask.cli import with_appcontext
from werkzeug.security import generate_password_hash
from app import db
from models import Organization, Role, User

def seed_roles():
    roles = [
        {"name": "SUPER_ADMIN", "description": "Super administrator with all permissions."},
        {"name": "ADMIN", "description": "Administrator with organization-wide permissions."},
        {"name": "HR_MANAGER", "description": "HR manager with employee management permissions."},
        {"name": "EMPLOYEE", "description": "Regular employee with limited permissions."},
    ]
    for role_data in roles:
        role = Role.query.filter_by(name=role_data["name"]).first()
        if not role:
            role = Role(name=role_data["name"], description=role_data["description"])
            db.session.add(role)
            click.echo(f"✅ Created role: {role.name}")
        else:
            click.echo(f"✅ Role '{role.name}' already exists")
    db.session.commit()

def seed_organization():
    org_name = "AKS Logistics"
    org = Organization.query.filter_by(name=org_name).first()
    if not org:
        org = Organization(name=org_name)
        db.session.add(org)
        db.session.commit()
        click.echo(f"✅ Created organization: {org_name}")
    else:
        click.echo(f"✅ Organization '{org_name}' already exists")
    return org

def seed_super_admin(org):
    email = "superadmin@akslogistics.com"
    user = User.query.filter_by(email=email).first()
    if user:
        click.echo("✅ Super Admin user already exists")
        return
    role = Role.query.filter_by(name="SUPER_ADMIN").first()
    if not role:
        click.echo("❌ SUPER_ADMIN role not found. Please seed roles first.")
        return
    password_hash = generate_password_hash("Admin@123")
    user = User(
        username="superadmin",
        email=email,
        password_hash=password_hash,
        first_name="Super",
        last_name="Admin",
        organization_id=org.id,
        role_id=role.id,
        must_reset_password=False,
        is_active=True
    )
    db.session.add(user)
    db.session.commit()
    click.echo("✅ Super Admin user created")

@click.group()
def seed():
    """Seed the database with default roles, organization, and Super Admin user."""
    pass

@seed.command("run")
@with_appcontext
def run():
    try:
        seed_roles()
        org = seed_organization()
        seed_super_admin(org)
    except Exception as e:
        db.session.rollback()
        click.echo(f"❌ Error during seeding: {e}")
        raise
    finally:
        db.session.close()

# To register the CLI command, add the following to your app.py or main.py:
# from seed import seed
# app.cli.add_command(seed)

content.text: My Flask + PostgreSQL development database crashed during Alembic migration due to a laptop shutdown, and now I’m getting this error:
Can't read recordId(=845703, offset: 3382872]: outside of allocated region [<2073768]
I want to completely fix this cleanly. Please do the following:
Drop and recreate the development database from scratch.
Database name is the same as used in the .env / SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI.
It’s safe to drop because this is a dev environment.
Re-run Flask-Migrate migrations so that the database schema is fully recreated:
flask db upgrade
Re-run seed data to insert:
Default organization: AKS Logistics
Roles: SUPER_ADMIN, ADMIN, HR_MANAGER, EMPLOYEE
Super Admin user (with secure hashed password)
Confirm the database structure matches the latest models with:
flask db current
flask db history
Start the Flask application to ensure everything runs without corruption errors.
⚠️ If needed, generate a fresh migration from the models using flask db revision --autogenerate if the existing migrations are broken.
✅ Expected Outcome:
Database is cleanly recreated
All migrations apply successfully
Seed data is populated
Flask app runs without the “outside of allocated region” error
Context:
In the current system, the Super Admin role is supposed to see all menus by default.
However, due to additional configuration checks (e.g., feature toggles or organization-level settings), some menus are hidden even for the Super Admin.
Goal:
Update the menu rendering / access control logic so that if the logged-in user has the Super Admin role, they automatically bypass all other configuration restrictions and see every menu item.
Technical Requirements:
Identify the code section where menu visibility is filtered (e.g., based on user role, feature flags, or organization settings).
Add a Super Admin check that overrides these filters.
Ensure this works both in backend permission checks and frontend rendering if applicable.
Keep existing behavior for non–Super Admin users unchanged.
Add a short comment explaining this bypass logic for clarity.
Testing:
Login as Super Admin → All menus should be visible.
Login as a regular user → Only permitted menus should be visible.
Edge case: Ensure no performance degradation due to this override.
